version_description:
In this release we’ve completely redesigned the way you filter your search results. It’s now not only easier and quicker to do, but also far more comprehensive. Almost all of the options you’ve so often requested have been added. We're particularly excited about the new option to expand the radius of your room searches by 1 mile increments, up to 15 miles, right from the filter screen.

We’ve also made a number of further improvements to the conversation design, optimising the readability of long messages and giving greater emphasis to the sender, date and time, and read status.

Some apps allow you to pick up on one device where you left off on another. Apple calls this Handoff. We’ve begun to add support for it, allowing you to seamlessly switch between devices when you’re searching through results or browsing adverts. You'll hear more about this (and see it in action) in future versions of the app.

Lastly, we’re providng some of our users with an advanced preview of the advert screen. After many conversations with our users and a review of the feedback we’ve received about its presentation, we’ve arrived at a design that, we feel, highlights the most important information, prioritises photos and videos, and provides greater clarity.

We recognise that there’s always room for improvement - nothing is ever perfect. And so, we’d love to hear your thoughts on these updates - good or bad. You can get in touch by email (customerservices@spareroom.co.uk) or tweet (@SpareRoomUK).

In this release we’ve made a number of minor changes and fixes to improve the app’s speed and reliability.

As always, if you'd like to provide us with feedback or report a problem you're having with the app, we'd love to hear from you. It's best to get in touch by email (customerservices@spareroom.co.uk) or tweet (@SpareRoomUK).

If you're finding SpareRoom to be helpful in your search for a flat or flatmate, we'd really appreciate a glowing review on the App Store. They're not only warmly received, but also help others in similar situations to yourself to benefit from our service.

We’ve also made improvements to wording, icons and buttons to make them more clear, accessible and user-friendly.

In this update, we’ve introduced profiles — a quick way to get to know other users a little better. Tap on any profile photo to see more about them, their search, and their ads. You can view your own too.
 
We’ve also overhauled the design and functionality of the home screen. Searching remains a central part of it, but it’s now accompanied by a series of intelligent suggestions that help you to make the most of your account, improve your advert, and so much more. This will roll out to you over the coming weeks.
 
We’d love to hear your thoughts! 
 
You can get in touch with our award-winning customer services team using our new feedback options at the bottom of the home screen.

In this update, we’ve redesigned the list of searches. Instead of seeing your recent ones separated from your saved ones, you’ll see we’ve combined them into one list and ordered them by the last time you used them. We’ve also added a list of example searches, so you can see what types of search you can do, and made more prominent whether you’ve activated search alerts. 

We’ve also made a few minor fixes and tweaks, including making it a little quicker to sign in and register.

In this update, you’ll see we’ve added a brand new section to our app: Featured Advertising. You'll find it on the Account screen.

With Featured Advertising, you can promote your room or whole property ads to the top of the search results. Plus, you’ll only pay when you get results — for taps on your ad. 

Mirroring our website’s functionality, you’ll be able to top-up your budget, adjust your bids per click, track ad performance, view your transaction history, and so much more — all from our app. We’ll be rolling out this functionality over the next few weeks.

We’d love to hear your thoughts about it and the other things we can do to improve. You can get in touch with our award-winning customer services team using our new feedback option at the bottom of the home screen.

In this update, you’ll see we’ve redesigned a few screens and made accessibility improvements throughout our app.

Our new, reorganised Account screen makes finding the information you need easier and quicker. It’s more intelligent too, providing important information – like the number of active ads or days remaining on your upgrade – in one glance. It also lays the foundations for significant upcoming changes.

We’ve also overhauled the design of our Post Ad screen — explaining why you should post one for either your search for a room or for a flatmate/tenant. Hint: it’s really effective. Plus, we’ve improved the usability of resuming or discarding a draft ad.

Finally, you can now use Google’s Gmail app – as well as Apple’s Mail app – to get in touch with us for support.

We’d love to hear your thoughts about these changes and the other things we can do to improve. You can get in touch with our award-winning customer services team using our new feedback option at the bottom of the home screen.

In this update, you’ll see that we’ve added the option to access SpareRoom USA from within our SpareRoom UK app. Before signing in or creating an account, we’ll ask you to select the country you’re searching in for a room, property, or flatmate. It’s quick and easy to switch between countries, too. You’ll find options on the Home and Account screens.

FYI: To use SpareRoom in both countries, you’ll need an account for each of them. It isn’t possible to use one account for both.

In this update, we’ll start to roll-out a redesigned Ad screen that introduces larger photos, structured content that’s easier to browse through, and greater consistency between ads.

You’ll also see a redesigned Settings screen that makes it easier to edit your details and update your notification preferences. We’ll be adding more options to this screen in coming weeks and months.

Lastly, we’ve introduced upgrade renewal discounts (matching our website). Put simply, if you choose to extend your upgrade while it’s still active, we’ll discount it by around 10%.

As always, we’d love to hear your thoughts on these changes and on other things we can do to improve. You can get in touch with our award-winning customer services team using our new feedback option at the bottom of the home screen.

In this update, we've made it significantly easier to contact our award-winning customer services team. In addition to calling them, you can now send a message without an email account set up on your device, without leaving our app, and even without a SpareRoom account. 

You'll also see a few visual changes and tweaks. Photos are larger and less widescreen in the search results. Adding photos to your ad and profile now takes advantage of Apple's native camera and its new functionality. Recommendations on the Home screen also use a new style following on from our rebrand. We've made many others in this update, and you'll see even more in coming weeks and months.

We've also made it possible to hide ads on the Map screen.

As always, we’d love to hear your thoughts on these changes and on other things we can do to improve. You can get in touch using our new feedback option at the bottom of the home screen.

In this update, we've made it significantly easier to contact our award-winning customer services team. In addition to calling them, you can now send a message without an email account set up on your device, without leaving our app, and even without a SpareRoom account. 

You'll also see a few visual changes and tweaks. Photos are larger and less widescreen in the search results. Adding photos to your ad and profile now takes advantage of Apple's native camera and its new functionality. Recommendations on the Home screen also use a new style following on from our rebrand. We've made many others in this update, and you'll see even more in coming weeks and months.
